newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Moroccan bourse ends two-hour session lower.
newsitem.headline: Moroccan bourse ends two-hour session lower.

text.p: The Casablanca bourse on Monday closed its two-hour session 0.22 percent lower compared with the previous session, traders said.
The all-share index closed at 432.28 points from 433.24 points over the previous session.
"The drop in largest capitalisation firms, including Societe Nationale d'Investissement (SNI), was mainly behind the bourse index decline," a Casablanca-based stockbroker said.
SNI, which has diversified stakes in more than 40 companies, lost 10 dirhams in one session to close at 540 dirhams.
SNI is Morocco's second largest private conglomerate with a market capitalisation of more than 5.5 billion dirhams.
ONA Group, the country's largest private group, was traded on Monday below the 500-dirham line for the first time since October, a broker said. It lost three dirhams to close at 475 dirhams.
Banque Marocaine du Commerce Exterieur, one of the liquid stocks, lost one dirham, to close at 395 dirhams.
Traded volume on the official market was 15.5 million dirhams, down from 22.5 million dirhams last Friday.
